RetroRules’s Documentation¶

Introduction¶

Welcome RetroRules’s documentation. This tool provides a docker that can be accessed using the command line interface for dynamically generating reaction rules file, from RetroRules that is RetroPath2.0 friendly.

To build the docker, you can use the following command:

docker build -t brsynth/retrorules-standalone:v2 .

To return the reaction rules, you can call the run function using:

python run.py -rule_type retro -output rules.tar -diameters 2,8 -output_format tar

API¶

class rpTool.passRules(output, rule_type='all', diameters=[2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14, 16], output_format='csv')¶

Parse the input file and return the reactions rules at the appropriate diameters

Parameters

  • output (str) – Path to the output file

  • rule_type (str) – The rule type to return. Valid options: all, forward, retro. (Default: all)

  • diameters (list) – The diameters to return. Valid options: 2,4,6,8,10,12,14,16. (Default: [2,4,6,8,10,12,14,16])

  • output_format (str) – The output format. Valid options: csv, tar. (Default: csv)

Return type

bool

Returns

Success or failure of the function

class rpTool.parseRules(rule_file, output, rule_type='all', diameters=[2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 14, 16], input_format='csv', output_format='csv')¶

Parse the rules if a user inputs it as a file

Parameters

  • rule_file (str) – Path to the rule file

  • output (str) – Path to the output file

  • rule_type (str) – The rule type to return. Valid options: all, forward, retro. (Default: all)

  • diameters (list) – The diameters to return. Valid options: 2,4,6,8,10,12,14,16. (Default: [2,4,6,8,10,12,14,16])

  • intput_format – The input file format. Valid options: csv, tar. (Default: csv)

  • output_format (str) – The output format. Valid options: csv, tar. (Default: csv)

Return type

bool

Returns

Success or failure of the function

class run.main(output, output_format='tar', rule_type='retro', diameters='2,4,6,8,10,12,14,16', rules_file='None', input_format='csv')¶

Parse the rules if a user inputs it as a file

Parameters

  • output (str) – Path to the output file

  • output_format (str) – Format to the output

  • rule_type (str) – The rule type to return. Valid options: all, forward, retro. (Default: all)

  • diameters (list) – The diameters to return. Valid options: 2,4,6,8,10,12,14,16. (Default: ‘2,4,6,8,10,12,14,16’)

  • rules_file (str) – The input rules file (Default: None)

  • intput_format – The input file format. Valid options: csv, tar. (Default: csv)

Return type

None

Returns

None
